data.title: Financial and Annual Reports
data.meta_description: Our financial highlights, Annual Report and other accomplishments.
data.text:
Charity Ratings

Eighty-three cents of every dollar we spend goes to people affected by Parkinson’s disease (PD) through funding groundbreaking research, life-changing programs and community outreach efforts. Our commitment to being good stewards of our supporters’ dollars has resulted in the highest ratings from organizations that evaluate charities.

Charity Navigator

Charity Navigator, the nation’s largest and most-utilized evaluator of charities, awarded the Parkinson’s Foundation its highest four-star rating for exceeding industry standards through exceptional performance and accountability. Charity Navigator’s ratings indicate how efficient a charity uses their support today, how well it has sustained its programs and services over time and its commitment to good governance.

GuideStar

The Parkinson’s Foundation has earned the Platinum Seal from GuideStar, the world’s largest source of nonprofit information, for its commitment to transparency.

Better Business Bureau Wise Giving Alliance

The Parkinson’s Foundation has been designated as an Accredited Charity by the Better Business Bureau Wise Giving Alliance (BBB Wise Giving Alliance), meeting all 20 BBB Charity Standards.

Nonprofit Analytics

Nonprofit Analytics has granted the Parkinson’s Foundation its Excellence in Giving Transparency Certificate for unfailingly providing the community with transparent, accurate information.

Charities Aid Foundation (CAF)

The Parkinson’s Foundation has been certified as a CAF International Validated Organization. This badge is awarded to nonprofits that are structured and operate as nonprofit entities and complete an extensive application and due diligence process with one of CAF International’s Global Offices.
